title.raw: 卷二 惠帝紀 Volume 2: Annals of Emperor Hui

sentences.zh: 孝惠皇帝，高祖太子也，母曰呂皇后。

translations.literal: Emperor Hui was Gaozu's crown prince, his mother was Empress Lü.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Hui was Gaozu's crown prince, with Empress Lü as his mother.

sentences.zh: 帝年五歲，高祖初為漢王。

translations.literal: The Emperor was five years old when Gaozu first became Han King.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor was five years old when Gaozu first became King of Han.

sentences.zh: 二年，立為太子。

translations.literal: In the second year, he was established as crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, he was established as crown prince.

sentences.zh: 十二年四月，高祖 崩。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, fourth month, Gaozu passed away.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, fourth month, Gaozu passed away.

sentences.zh: 五月丙寅，太子即皇帝位，尊皇后曰皇太后。

translations.literal: Fifth month, Bingyin day, the crown prince ascended the imperial throne, honoring the Empress as Empress Dowager.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth month, on the day Bingyin, the crown prince ascended the imperial throne and honored the empress as Empress Dowager.

sentences.zh: 賜民爵一級。

translations.literal: He granted the people one level of nobility rank.
translations.idiomatic: He granted the people one level of nobility rank.

sentences.zh: 中郎、郎中滿六歲爵三級，四歲二級。

translations.literal: 元年，冬十二月，帝晨出射。
translations.idiomatic: First year, winter, twelfth month, the Emperor went out early in the morning to hunt with bow and arrow.

sentences.zh: 外郎滿六歲二級。

translations.literal: 上林平樂館。
translations.idiomatic: At the Shanglin Park's Pinglao Pavilion.

sentences.zh: 中郎不滿一歲一級。

translations.literal: 虎圈獸搏，帝射虎，車駕馳入，虎搏殿上侍中侍郎。
translations.idiomatic: At the tiger enclosure where beasts fought, the Emperor shot a tiger; the imperial carriage charged in, and the tiger attacked the attendants and court gentlemen on the palace hall.

sentences.zh: 外郎不滿二歲賜錢萬。

translations.literal: 侍中郎中馳入，射中虎。
translations.idiomatic: The attendants and palace gentlemen charged in and shot the tiger.

sentences.zh: 宦官尚食比郎中。

translations.literal: 明年，春，淮陽守申屠嘉心諫上曰：「周天子重於民上，諸侯重於附庸，卿大夫重於士，士重於農夫，皆所以崇民也。
translations.idiomatic: The next year, spring, the governor of Huaiyang, Shen Tu Jia, sincerely remonstrated with the Emperor, saying: 'The Zhou Son of Heaven honored the people above himself, the feudal lords honored their dependencies, the ministers honored the scholars, and the scholars honored the farmers—all this was to elevate the people.

sentences.zh: 謁者、執楯、執戟、武士、騶比外郎。

translations.literal: 今陛下春秋方二十，親自射虎，駭不測之淵。
translations.idiomatic: Now Your Majesty is only twenty years old and personally shot a tiger, startling yourself with unforeseen dangers.

sentences.zh: 太子御驂乘賜爵五大夫，舍人滿五歲二級。

translations.literal: 若有狂夫之流，虎搏執輿，陛下何以救之？
translations.idiomatic: If there were a madman among them and the tiger attacked the imperial carriage, how would Your Majesty save yourself?

sentences.zh: 賜給喪事者，二千石錢二萬，六百石以上萬，五百石、二百石以 下至佐史五千。

translations.literal: 事即有緩急，奈何？
translations.idiomatic: If matters became urgent, what then?

sentences.zh: 視作斥上者，將軍四十金，二千石二十金，六百石以上六金，五百石以下至佐史二金。

translations.literal: 臣願陛下法太宗，御史大夫周昌謹慎，未嘗不稱善也。
translations.idiomatic: I wish Your Majesty would follow Emperor Taizong and Grandee Secretary Zhou Chang, who was cautious and never failed to be commended.

sentences.zh: 減田租，復十五稅一。

translations.literal: 臣嘉誠不足以知陛下，必謂陛下不隆於孝文。」
translations.idiomatic: This subject Jia is truly inadequate to advise Your Majesty, but I must say that Your Majesty does not honor Emperor Xiaowen as much.'

sentences.zh: 爵五大夫、吏六百石以上及宦皇帝而知 名者有罪當盜械者，皆頌繫。

translations.literal: 上曰：「吾惟之。」
translations.idiomatic: The Emperor said, 'I will consider this.'

sentences.zh: 上造以上及內外公孫耳孫有罪當刑及當為城旦舂者，皆耐為鬼薪白粲。

translations.literal: 壬午，赦天下。
translations.idiomatic: On the day Renwu, he granted amnesty to the world.

sentences.zh: 民年七十以上若不滿十歲有罪當刑者，皆完之。

translations.literal: 二年，春，正月，乙卯，地震，羌道、武都道山崩。
translations.idiomatic: Second year, spring, first month, day Yimao, there was an earthquake; mountains collapsed in Qiang Prefecture and Wudu Prefecture.

sentences.zh: 又曰：「吏所以 治民也，能盡其治則民賴之，故重其祿，所以為民也。

translations.literal: 夏，旱。
translations.idiomatic: Summer, drought.

sentences.zh: 今吏六百石以上父母妻子與同居，及故吏嘗佩將軍都尉印將兵及佩二千石官印者，家唯給軍賦，他無有所與。

translations.literal: 秋，九月，蝗。
translations.idiomatic: Autumn, ninth month, locusts.

translations.literal: Emperor Hui was Gaozu's crown prince, with Empress Lü as his mother. The emperor was five years old when Gaozu first became King of Han. In the second year, he was established as crown prince. In the twelfth year, fourth month, Gaozu passed away. In the fifth month, on the day Bingyin, the crown prince ascended the imperial throne and honored the empress as Empress Dowager. He granted the people one level of nobility rank. First year, winter, twelfth month, the Emperor went out early in the morning to hunt with bow and arrow. At the Shanglin Park's Pinglao Pavilion. At the tiger enclosure where beasts fought, the Emperor shot a tiger; the imperial carriage charged in, and the tiger attacked the attendants and court gentlemen on the palace hall. The attendants and palace gentlemen charged in and shot the tiger. The next year, spring, the governor of Huaiyang, Shen Tu Jia, sincerely remonstrated with the Emperor, saying: 'The Zhou Son of Heaven honored the people above himself, the feudal lords honored their dependencies, the ministers honored the scholars, and the scholars honored the farmers—all this was to elevate the people. Now Your Majesty is only twenty years old and personally shot a tiger, startling yourself with unforeseen dangers. If there were a madman among them and the tiger attacked the imperial carriage, how would Your Majesty save yourself? If matters became urgent, what then? I wish Your Majesty would follow Emperor Taizong and Grandee Secretary Zhou Chang, who was cautious and never failed to be commended. This subject Jia is truly inadequate to advise Your Majesty, but I must say that Your Majesty does not honor Emperor Xiaowen as much.' The Emperor said, 'I will consider this.' On the day Renwu, he granted amnesty to the world. Second year, spring, first month, day Yimao, there was an earthquake; mountains collapsed in Qiang Prefecture and Wudu Prefecture. Summer, drought. Autumn, ninth month, locusts.

sentences.zh: 令郡諸侯王立高廟。

translations.literal: 三年，春，陇西地震。
translations.idiomatic: Third year, spring, earthquake in Longxi.

translations.literal: Third year, spring, earthquake in Longxi.

sentences.zh: 元年冬十二月，趙隱王如意薨。

translations.literal: 夏六月，丁未，赦。
translations.idiomatic: Summer, sixth month, day Dingwei, amnesty.

sentences.zh: 民有罪，得買爵三十級以免死罪。

translations.literal: 秋七月，辛亥，丞相臣平薨。
translations.idiomatic: Autumn, seventh month, day Xinhai, Chancellor Chen Ping passed away.

sentences.zh: 賜民爵，戶一級。

translations.literal: 四年，冬十月，丙寅，立皇后張氏。
translations.idiomatic: Fourth year, winter, tenth month, day Bingyin, he established Empress Zhang.

translations.literal: Summer, sixth month, day Dingwei, amnesty. Autumn, seventh month, day Xinhai, Chancellor Chen Ping passed away. Fourth year, winter, tenth month, day Bingyin, he established Empress Zhang.

sentences.zh: 春正月，城長安。

translations.literal: 五年，春，正月，甲子，帝崩于未央宮。
translations.idiomatic: Fifth year, spring, first month, day Jiazi, the Emperor passed away in Weiyang Palace.

translations.literal: Fifth year, spring, first month, day Jiazi, the Emperor passed away in Weiyang Palace.

sentences.zh: 二年冬十月，齊悼惠王來朝，獻城陽郡以益魯元公主邑，尊公主為太后。

translations.literal: 時年二十四。
translations.idiomatic: He was twenty-four years old at the time.

translations.literal: He was twenty-four years old at the time.

sentences.zh: 春正月癸酉，有兩龍見蘭陵家人井中，乙亥夕而不見。

translations.literal: 葬安陵。
translations.idiomatic: He was buried at Anling.

sentences.zh: 隴西地震。

translations.literal: 贊曰：孝惠皇帝，高后稱制，政不出房戶，天下晏然。
translations.idiomatic: Appraisal: Emperor Hui was filial; Empress Dowager Lü held the reins of government, but politics did not emerge from the women's quarters, and the world was peaceful.

translations.literal: He was buried at Anling. Appraisal: Emperor Hui was filial; Empress Dowager Lü held the reins of government, but politics did not emerge from the women's quarters, and the world was peaceful.

sentences.zh: 夏旱。

translations.literal: 百姓務本，衣食滋殖。
translations.idiomatic: The common people attended to fundamentals, and clothing and food increased abundantly.

sentences.zh: 郃陽侯仲薨。

translations.literal: 亡為兵革之變，民間無狗吠之警。
translations.idiomatic: There were no changes of armor and weapons; among the people there were no alarms of barking dogs.

sentences.zh: 秋七月辛未，相國何薨。

translations.literal: 天下晏然，不獨為惠，亦呂氏之力也。
translations.idiomatic: The world was peaceful, not only due to Hui's virtue, but also the strength of the Lü clan.

translations.literal: The common people attended to fundamentals, and clothing and food increased abundantly. There were no changes of armor and weapons; among the people there were no alarms of barking dogs. The world was peaceful, not only due to Hui's virtue, but also the strength of the Lü clan.

sentences.zh: 三年春，發長安六百里內男女十四萬六千人城長安，三十日罷。

translations.literal: 高后既立諸呂為三王，諸大夫躊躇不能有所發明。
translations.idiomatic: After Empress Dowager Lü established the various Lü as three kings, the various ministers hesitated and could not initiate any action.

translations.literal: After Empress Dowager Lü established the various Lü as three kings, the various ministers hesitated and could not initiate any action.

sentences.zh: 以宗室女為公主，嫁匈奴單于。

translations.literal: 以故孝惠崩，呂后為政，欲以呂氏為重臣。
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, when Emperor Hui passed away and Empress Lü governed, she wished to make the Lü clan important ministers.

translations.literal: Therefore, when Emperor Hui passed away and Empress Lü governed, she wished to make the Lü clan important ministers.

sentences.zh: 夏五月，立閩越君搖為東海王。

translations.literal: 終臣放弑，禍稔蕭牆。
translations.idiomatic: In the end, subjects were banished and assassinated, calamity ripening within the inner walls.

translations.literal: In the end, subjects were banished and assassinated, calamity ripening within the inner walls.

sentences.zh: 六月，發諸侯王、列侯徒隸二萬人城長安。

translations.literal: 孝惠本好文學，然亦以不能持大政。
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Hui was originally fond of literature, but also because he could not manage great governance.

translations.literal: Emperor Hui was originally fond of literature, but also because he could not manage great governance.

sentences.zh: 秋七月，都廄災。

translations.literal: 呂后攝政，王諸呂，權重於帝室。
translations.idiomatic: Empress Lü took charge of government, enfeoffed the various Lü, and their power grew heavier than the imperial house.

sentences.zh: 南越王趙佗稱臣奉貢。

translations.literal: 及呂后崩，宗室諸王共誅之。
translations.idiomatic: When Empress Lü passed away, the imperial clansmen and various kings together executed them.

translations.literal: Empress Lü took charge of government, enfeoffed the various Lü, and their power grew heavier than the imperial house. When Empress Lü passed away, the imperial clansmen and various kings together executed them.

sentences.zh: 四年冬十月壬寅，立皇后張氏。

translations.literal: 豈非天邪？
translations.idiomatic: Was this not heaven's will?

translations.literal: Was this not heaven's will?

sentences.zh: 春正月，舉民孝弟力田者復其身。

translations.literal: 初，高祖不修文学，而性明達，好謀，能聽，自監門戍卒，史書，騎士，其所與游處，見之如舊。
translations.idiomatic: Initially, Gaozu did not cultivate literature, but his nature was clear and understanding, fond of planning, able to listen; from palace gate guards, clerks, scribes, and cavalrymen, those he associated with, he saw them as old friends.

translations.literal: Initially, Gaozu did not cultivate literature, but his nature was clear and understanding, fond of planning, able to listen; from palace gate guards, clerks, scribes, and cavalrymen, those he associated with, he saw them as old friends.

sentences.zh: 三月甲子，皇帝冠，赦天下。

translations.literal: 及為帝王，天下無不欲陳事而見之。
translations.idiomatic: When he became emperor and king, everyone in the world wished to present matters and meet with him.

sentences.zh: 省法令妨吏民者；

translations.literal: 然高祖待人無顧藉，雖賤如己，不害其親厚。
translations.idiomatic: Yet Gaozu treated people without reservations; even those as lowly as himself, he did not harm their close friendship.

sentences.zh: 除挾書律。

translations.literal: 群臣非素富貴，無不敬而愛之。
translations.idiomatic: The ministers who were not originally wealthy and noble, none failed to respect and love him.

sentences.zh: 長樂宮鴻臺災。

translations.literal: 至於布衣冠軍之將，馳驅從之，撫之若子弟，故皆樂為之死。
translations.idiomatic: As for the generals who were commoners and champions, they galloped following him; he caressed them like sons and younger brothers, so all were happy to die for him.

sentences.zh: 宜陽雨血。

translations.literal: 至孝惠帝，恭讓自循，禮義不敢有所縱逸。
translations.idiomatic: As for Emperor Hui, he was respectful and yielding, following proper conduct; in ritual and righteousness he dared not be at all indulgent or unrestrained.

translations.literal: When he became emperor and king, everyone in the world wished to present matters and meet with him. Yet Gaozu treated people without reservations; even those as lowly as himself, he did not harm their close friendship. The ministers who were not originally wealthy and noble, none failed to respect and love him. As for the generals who were commoners and champions, they galloped following him; he caressed them like sons and younger brothers, so all were happy to die for him. As for Emperor Hui, he was respectful and yielding, following proper conduct; in ritual and righteousness he dared not be at all indulgent or unrestrained.

sentences.zh: 秋七月乙亥，未央宮凌室災；

translations.literal: 大臣親信心，無不愛而敬之。
translations.idiomatic: The great ministers trusted and were close to him, none failed to love and respect him.

sentences.zh: 丙子，織室災。

translations.literal: 百姓聞其風聲，爭自以為不如孝惠帝。
translations.idiomatic: The common people heard of his reputation and competed to consider themselves inferior to Emperor Hui.

translations.literal: The great ministers trusted and were close to him, none failed to love and respect him. The common people heard of his reputation and competed to consider themselves inferior to Emperor Hui.

sentences.zh: 五年冬十月，剨；

translations.literal: 而呂太后女主，天下無賢臣，宗室諸王王侯莫能為變。
translations.idiomatic: But Empress Lü was the female ruler; the world had no worthy ministers, and the imperial clansmen and various kings and marquises could not create change.

sentences.zh: 桃李華，棗實。

translations.literal: 蓋所以禍至於此也。
translations.idiomatic: This was how calamity came to this point.

translations.literal: But Empress Lü was the female ruler; the world had no worthy ministers, and the imperial clansmen and various kings and marquises could not create change. This was how calamity came to this point.

sentences.zh: 春正月，復發長安六百里內男女十四萬五千人城長安，三十日罷。

translations.literal: 初，孝惠為太子，呂后為皇后。
translations.idiomatic: Initially, when Hui was crown prince, Lü was empress.

translations.literal: Initially, when Hui was crown prince, Lü was empress.

sentences.zh: 夏，大旱。

translations.literal: 生魯元公主，後生孝惠帝。
translations.idiomatic: She gave birth to Princess Lu Yuan, and later gave birth to Emperor Hui.

translations.literal: She gave birth to Princess Lu Yuan, and later gave birth to Emperor Hui.

sentences.zh: 秋八月己丑，相國參薨。

translations.literal: 孝惠元年，皇后無子。
translations.idiomatic: In Emperor Hui's first year, the Empress had no children.

translations.literal: In Emperor Hui's first year, the Empress had no children.

sentences.zh: 九月，長安城成。

translations.literal: 秋，立皇后張氏。
translations.idiomatic: Autumn, he established Empress Zhang.

sentences.zh: 賜民爵，戶一級。

translations.literal: 四年，冬十月，皇后張氏薨。
translations.idiomatic: Fourth year, winter, tenth month, Empress Zhang passed away.

translations.literal: Autumn, he established Empress Zhang. Fourth year, winter, tenth month, Empress Zhang passed away.

sentences.zh: 令民得賣爵。

translations.literal: 五年，春，正月，丁亥，立皇后王氏。
translations.idiomatic: Fifth year, spring, first month, day Dinghai, he established Empress Wang.

sentences.zh: 女子年十五以上至三十不嫁，五算。

translations.literal: 皇后王氏，生太子。
translations.idiomatic: Empress Wang gave birth to the crown prince.

translations.literal: Fifth year, spring, first month, day Dinghai, he established Empress Wang. Empress Wang gave birth to the crown prince.

sentences.zh: 夏六月，舞陽侯噲薨。

translations.literal: 七年，冬，孝惠帝崩。
translations.idiomatic: Seventh year, winter, Emperor Hui passed away.

translations.literal: Seventh year, winter, Emperor Hui passed away.

sentences.zh: 起長安西巿，修敖倉。

translations.literal: 呂太后立皇后子為帝，名為弘。
translations.idiomatic: Empress Lü established the Empress's son as emperor, naming him Hong.

translations.literal: Empress Lü established the Empress's son as emperor, naming him Hong.

sentences.zh: 七年冬十月，發車騎、材官詣滎陽，太尉灌嬰將。

translations.literal: 後崩，未葬，而諸呂欲為亂。
translations.idiomatic: Later she passed away, not yet buried, and the various Lü wished to create disorder.

translations.literal: Later she passed away, not yet buried, and the various Lü wished to create disorder.

sentences.zh: 春正月辛丑朔，日有蝕之。

translations.literal: 丞相陳平，太尉周勃，大將軍灌嬰，朱虛侯劉章等謀誅呂氏。
translations.idiomatic: Chancellor Chen Ping, Grand Commandant Zhou Bo, Grand General Guan Ying, Marquis of Zhu Xu Liu Zhang and others plotted to execute the Lü clan.

sentences.zh: 夏五月丁卯，日有蝕之，既。

translations.literal: 初，孝惠崩，葬未央宮。
translations.idiomatic: Initially, when Emperor Hui passed away, he was buried at Weiyang Palace.

translations.literal: Chancellor Chen Ping, Grand Commandant Zhou Bo, Grand General Guan Ying, Marquis of Zhu Xu Liu Zhang and others plotted to execute the Lü clan. Initially, when Emperor Hui passed away, he was buried at Weiyang Palace.

sentences.zh: 秋八月戊寅，帝崩于未央宮。

translations.literal: 呂后哭而泣，不食，曰：「此豈人所為！
translations.idiomatic: Empress Lü wept and cried, not eating, saying: 'How could a person do this!

sentences.zh: 九月辛丑，葬安陵。

translations.literal: 顧帝竟以天下賂呂產邪？」
translations.idiomatic: Did the Emperor ultimately bribe Lü Chan with the world?'

translations.literal: Empress Lü wept and cried, not eating, saying: 'How could a person do this! Did the Emperor ultimately bribe Lü Chan with the world?'

sentences.zh: 贊曰：孝惠內修親親，外禮宰相，優寵齊悼、趙隱，恩敬篤矣。

translations.literal: 未葬，呂后崩。
translations.idiomatic: Before burial, Empress Lü passed away.

sentences.zh: 聞叔孫通之諫則懼然，納曹相國之對而心說，可謂寬仁之主。

translations.literal: 呂產、呂祿相謂曰：「呂氏之王，皇帝之約也。
translations.idiomatic: Lü Chan and Lü Lu said to each other: 'The enfeoffment of the Lü clan was the emperor's agreement.

sentences.zh: 遭呂太后虧損至德，悲夫！

translations.literal: 今帝亡，雖少，孰敢亂者？」
translations.idiomatic: Now the emperor is gone; though young, who would dare create disorder?'

translations.literal: Before burial, Empress Lü passed away. Lü Chan and Lü Lu said to each other: 'The enfeoffment of the Lü clan was the emperor's agreement. Now the emperor is gone; though young, who would dare create disorder?'
